meanings.definition: A person or thing that is single, unique, or solitary.
meanings.sent1: The old lighthouse standing alone on the cliff was a singleton in the vast landscape.
meanings.sent2: The diamond-encrusted necklace was a prized singleton in her jewelry collection.
meanings.sent3: The lone tree in the middle of the field looked like a cheerful singleton waving to the passing clouds.
meanings.sent4: Her bright red umbrella was the only singleton of color in the sea of black umbrellas.
meanings.sent5: The rare stamp was a valuable singleton in his collection, unmatched by any other.

meanings.definition: A set with only one member.
meanings.sent1: The number '1' is a singleton in the set of natural numbers.
meanings.sent2: The letter 'A' is a singleton in the set of vowels.
meanings.sent3: The lonely apple in the basket was a singleton among the oranges.
meanings.sent4: The red card was the only singleton in the deck of blue cards.
meanings.sent5: The special edition coin was a rare singleton in the collection of coins.

meanings.definition: A child born as the only one in a multiple birth.
meanings.sent1: The doctor carefully monitored the health of the newborn singleton.
meanings.sent2: Being a singleton in a multiple birth can sometimes lead to a closer bond with the parents.
meanings.sent3: The little singleton was the star of the family, receiving all the attention.
meanings.sent4: The singleton baby was showered with love and affection from the entire family.
meanings.sent5: The newborn singleton was a precious gift, cherished by all.
